etymologies: mid 17th century; earliest use found in Robert Fleming (1630–1694), Presbyterian minister in the Netherlands. From down- + pouring

definitions: The action or an act of something pouring down, or being poured down; that which is poured down; a downpour.

etymologies: mid 17th century; earliest use found in George Rust (c1628–1670), Church of Ireland bishop of Dromore. From down- + pouring, after to pour down

definitions: Especially of rain or light: that pours down.
